intro: Galium afropusillum, commonly known as African bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth and along stream banks. The plant features slender, often hairy stems that are usually prostrate or ascending. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, oval berries that are dispersed by birds. Botanically, it belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar structural and ecological characteristics.
